titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Lavino Shipping Company was a Philadelphia-based maritime services company that performed terminalling and stevedoring.

scopecontent.p: Lavino Shipping Company log of port movements and work performed in 1943. The records are organized by vessel and list name of captain and owner, port of origin, dates and times of arrival, docking location, duration of loading or discharging of cargo, any other operations taking place while vessel was docked, draft of the vessel prior to departure, and the amount of fuel on arrival and departure. The materials being loaded and unloaded include chrome ore, magnesite ore, iron ore, molasses, sugar, crude oil, gasoline, steel, lumber, slag ballast, cement, scrap iron, and explosives. The set of records includes an overall index of arrivals in chronological order and separate indexes for each letter of the alphabet.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
